alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 12:14AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Outflow from decaying thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne, northwestern Thomas, western Rawlins, Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas and Hitchcock Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 1145 PM MDT/1245 AM CDT/... At 1110 PM MDT/1210 AM CDT/, outflow from decaying thunderstorms was located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Palisade to 3 miles northeast of Bird City to near Ruleton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Mesonet. St. Francis Aiport reported a wind gust of 46 mph associated with the outflow. The strong winds will occur with little to no rain. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... McDonald around 1230 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Goodland and Culbertson. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 6 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
